sources.title: King of the Bandits (1947) THE CISCO KIDüçï GILBERT ROLAND
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Gilbert Roland, Chris-Pin Martin, Angela Greene
Director: Christy Cabanne

Cisco finds himself caught up in a thrilling tale of mistaken identities, treachery, and heroism as he fights to protect the innocent and expose a ruthless villain. With his wit, charm, and sharpshooting skills, Cisco proves that even an outlaw can be the hero of the story.

TRIVIA: The Cisco Kid is a fictional character created by O. Henry for his short story "The Caballero's Way," first published in 1907. Four actors portrayed this Western hero in 25 films during the sound era. In 1928, the first all-talking western starred Warner Baxter as the Cisco Kid, followed by Cesar Romero, Duncan Renaldo, and Gilbert Roland.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

metadata.Plot: Traveling north into Arizona, Cisco finds that someone committing robberies has been impersonating him and he is a wanted man. After retrieving some of the stolen loot, he is caught with it in his posession and put in the guard house. A friend whose life he recently saved beaks him out and Cisco heads out to find the impersonator and clear himself.
metadata.Writer: Christy Cabanne, Bennett Cohen, Gilbert Roland
metadata.Actors: Gilbert Roland, Angela Greene, Chris-Pin Martin
